basic.floral_language:
Pachyveria pachytoides
Floriography: noble, beautiful, warm
Pachyveria pachytoides has ovate leaves with round edges, blue-green, with a very thin layer of white powder, in sunny environments leaves become pale pink and the plant becomes more compact, has a high ornamental value, quite popular in recent years among small succulents.
Pachyveria pachytoides likes sunny places, no dormancy. Bloom sometimes with a long scape emerging from the center of leaves, orange flowers in a bell-shape.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color blue green, when sunny leaf edges turning to light red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate sunlight no apparent period of dormancy
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, keep soil moist, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once every month
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
